articles.author: Zara Zadro
articles.summary: The weather for this year's Australia Day public holiday is looking warm with a slight chance of rain across the country. Perth is the hottest Australian capital on January 26, reaching highs of 35°C. Hobart is the coldest capital, with lows of 8°C and highs of 21°C during the day.

articles.title: Dead birds spotted along Highway 162 likely struck by cars in morning fog

articles.summary: Several dead birds were spotted along Highway 162 over the Thermalito Afterbay. The likely cause of death is that the birds were struck by vehicles during the early morning hours when fog limited visibility along the highway. Drivers in the area are urged to exercise caution to prevent further harm to wildlife.

articles.title: The 1.5°C temperature breach, what does it mean?
articles.author: The Herald
articles.summary: 2014 was Earth's hottest year on record. Global temperature has surpassed 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels for the first time in recorded history. The Paris Agreement, signed in 2015, set the goal of limiting global warming to well below 2 degrees' Celsius. However, with emissions on the rise, the world has to meet its goals to meet the heat-breaking heat of 2024.
